question: 足し算
sourceMnemonic: Remember how <ja>足す</ja> means "to add?" Add <kanji>calculate</kanji> to that and you'll have <vocabulary>addition</vocabulary>! It's the type of calculation you're doing when you add.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is the kun'yomi reading for <ja>足</ja> and the on'yomi for <ja>算</ja>. And the <ja>さん</ja> reading is rendaku'd into <ja>ざん</ja>. This is the same for all the math-ish words (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division), so try to remember that, because you'll see it again!
